ygData.subject: Re: spell changes
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I died so many times this weekend- it was pathetic and frustrating and had me seriously thinking about quitting the game altogether. I was trying to solo
ygData.messageBody:
On Tue, 25 May 1999, Wizard wrote:
> >too bad; i died several time this weekend =(
>
> I like this one very very much !! So dear friends finaly verant guys found
> that death penality is too big in world where is so easy to die by thousnds
> of random things wich can provoke it and if you must to pass 3 zones to get
> your corpse i think that you will thing twice about daing a same mistake
> again.

I died so many times this weekend- it was pathetic and frustrating and had
me seriously thinking about quitting the game altogether. I was trying to
solo in Crushbone and I only go out of the zone transition area once. The
trains would come in, my pet and I could handle all the green orcs and
then a slaver or taskmaster would show up and it was all over.

Since the only things I'd been killing were green orcs, I was losing more
experience than I was making. It was completely disheartening and I
finally went back to the Chessboard in Butcherblock to make up the
experience I lost. I find the Chessboard sort of boring and it is not very
good for loot either. In short, by getting killed three times, I'd lost
all the experience I'd made in a week and was driven to go fight in an
area that didn't interest me.

Which made the game not fun anymore. Luckily, I didn't make any rash
decisions. I'm level 10 and one of my goals in the game is to get to level
20. Hopefully, this lowering of the death penalty will help me accomplish
this goal with the minimum amount of frustration and the maximum amount of
fun.

Anya
High Elf Magician
Rallos Zek
